component.text: Use that as the router ID. If multiple interfaces are active, use the highest address.

Display console message:
%OSPFv3-4-NORTRID: OSPFv3 process 1 could not pick a router ID, please configure manually.

component.feedback: ***You must enter the exact and full command.***
component.existingcommands:
• Enter IPv6 OSPF router configuration mode using process ID 10
  • Assign a Router ID of 2.2.2.2
  • Return to privileged EXEC mode

command.deviceresponse: *Mar 29 11:24:53.739: %OSPFv3-4-NORTRID: Process OSPFv3-1-IPv6 could not pick a router-id, please configure manually

R2#
*Mar 25 20:03:56.863: %SYS-5-CONFIG_I: Configured from console by console
R2#
command.instruction: Verify the Router ID within the IPv6 OSPF protocol settings on R2.

command.deviceresponse:
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "connected"
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "ND"
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "ospf 10"
Router ID 2.2.2.2
Number of areas: 0 normal, 0 stub, 0 nssa
Redistribution:
None
R2#
command.instruction:
You are now configuring R3:
  • Enter OSPF router configuration mode using process ID 10
  • Assign a Router ID of 3.3.3.3
  • Return to privileged EXEC mode

command.deviceresponse: *Mar 29 11:24:53.739: %OSPFv3-4-NORTRID: Process OSPFv3-1-IPv6 could not pick a router-id, please configure manually

R3#
*Mar 25 20:11:05.415: %SYS-5-CONFIG_I: Configured from console by console
R3#
command.instruction: Verify the Router ID within the OSPF protocol settings on R3.

command.deviceresponse:
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "connected"
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "ND"
IPv6 Routing Protocol is "ospf 10"
Router ID 3.3.3.3
Number of areas: 0 normal, 0 stub, 0 nssa
Redistribution:
None
R3#
command.instruction: You successfully assigned the Router ID.
